dependencies.description:
imbalanced-learn is a python package offering a number of re-sampling
techniques commonly used in datasets showing strong between-class
imbalance. It is compatible with scikit-learn and is part of scikit-
learn-contrib projects.
dependencies.name: py-imbalanced-learn

dependencies.description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.
dependencies.name: py-ipython

dependencies.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependencies.name: py-matplotlib

dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-numpy

dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.
dependencies.name: py-pandas

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.
dependencies.name: py-pytest

dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.
dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn

dependencies.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.
dependencies.name: py-seaborn

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

description:
Multi-class imbalance is a common problem occurring in real-world
supervised classifications tasks. While there has already been some
research on the specialized methods aiming to tackle that challenging
problem, most of them still lack coherent Python implementation that is
simple, intuitive and easy to use. multi-imbalance is a python package
tackling the problem of multi-class imbalanced datasets in machine
learnin
name: py-multi-imbalance

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
